intro: Semecarpus trukkensis, commonly known as the Trukken sycamore, is a member of the Sapindaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters in height, characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing a single seed. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems, though it is relatively rare and understudied.
